comments.summary: A Future-wrapped `fs` API, for future-based, lazy, easy-to-model asynchrony that makes it easy to manipulate the file system.

structure.description: A Future-wrapped `fs` API, for future-based, lazy, easy-to-model asynchrony that makes it easy to manipulate the file system.

comments.summary: make a file string relative

structure.description: make a file string relative

comments.summary: Read a file asynchronously as a Future-wrapped value.

structure.description: Read a file asynchronously as a Future-wrapped value.

curried.name: readFileWithFormatAndCancel
curried.summary: Can be given a file encoding and a cancellation function.
curried.lines:
```js
    import { fork } from 'fluture'
    import { readFile } from 'file-system'
    fork(console.warn)(console.log)(
      readFileWithFormatAndCancel(() => process.exit(), 'utf8', './README.md')
    )
```

curried.name: readFileWithCancel
curried.lines:
```js
    import { fork } from 'fluture'
    import { readFile } from 'file-system'
    fork(console.warn)(console.log)(
      readFileWithCancel(() => process.exit(), './README.md')
    )
```

curried.name: readFile
curried.lines:
```js
    import { fork } from 'fluture'
    import { readFile } from 'file-system'
    fork(console.warn)(console.log)(readFile('./README.md'))
```

comments.summary: Remove a file, configurably, with cancellation. Unlike `fs.rm`, this returns the path of the deleted file as a Future-wrapped string.

structure.description: Remove a file, configurably, with cancellation. Unlike `fs.rm`, this returns the path of the deleted file as a Future-wrapped string.

curried.name: removeFileWithConfigAndCancel
curried.lines:
```js
     import { fork } from 'fluture'
     import { removeFileWithConfigAndCancel } from 'file-system'
     fork(console.warn)(console.log)(
       removeFileWithConfigAndCancel(
         cancellationFn,
         { ...fs.removeFileConfig },
         'my-file.txt'
       )
     )
```

curried.name: removeFileWithConfig
curried.lines:
```js
    import { fork } from 'fluture'
    import { removeFileWithConfig } from 'file-system'
    // [...]
    fork(console.warn)(console.log)(
      removeFileWithConfig(
        { ...fs.removeFileConfig },
        'my-file.txt'
      )
    )
```

comments.summary: Call external processes and consume them as a Future-wrapped value. This is a light wrapper around `execa`, so please see [execa](https://github.com/sindresorhus/execa)'s documentation for more info.

structure.description: Call external processes and consume them as a Future-wrapped value. This is a light wrapper around `execa`, so please see [execa](https://github.com/sindresorhus/execa)'s documentation for more info.

comments.summary: Consume external commands as a Future-wrapped value.

structure.description: Consume external commands as a Future-wrapped value.

curried.name: execWithConfig
curried.summary: Passes all possible configuration values plus a cancellation function.
curried.lines:
```js
    import { execWithConfig } from 'kiddo'
    import { fork } from 'fluture'
    fork(console.warn)(console.log)(
      execWithConfig(
        function customCancellationFunction() {},
        'echo',
        { cleanup: true },
        ['ahoy']
      )
    )
```

curried.name: execWithCancel
curried.summary: Eschews any configuration and instead only expects a cancellation function, command and arguments.
curried.lines:
```js
    import { execWithCancel } from 'kiddo'
    import { fork } from 'fluture'
    fork(console.warn)(console.log)(
      execWithCancel(
        function customCancellationFunction() {},
        'echo',
        ['ahoy']
      )
    )
```

curried.name: exec
curried.summary: Eschews any configuration or cancellation function. Needs only command and arguments.

comments.summary: Summarize a project, given: - the path to a `package.json` file - the path to a `dr-generated.json` file - the URI of a documentation site - the URI of a repository - (optional) a banner - or (optional) the path to a file which represents a banner

structure.description: Summarize a project, given: - the path to a `package.json` file - the path to a `dr-generated.json` file - the URI of a documentation site - the URI of a repository - (optional) a banner - or (optional) the path to a file which represents a banner
structure.name: summarize
example: " * [monocle](//repo.biz/packages/monocle) - inspect code and apply rules, magically 🧐",
" * [eslint-config-monoculture](//repo.biz/shared/eslint-config-monoculture) - shared eslint configuration for monoculture packages 🧹",
" * [jest-config](//repo.biz/shared/jest-config) - shared jest configuration for monoculture packages 🎪",
" * [digested](//repo.biz/tools/digested) - summarize and automatically generate information about your projects 🍽️",
" * [doctor-general-cli](//repo.biz/tools/doctor-general-cli) - documentation generation in a nice CLI 🫡",
" * [gitparty](//repo.biz/tools/gitparty) - visualize git logs with magical context 🎨",
" * [superorganism](//repo.biz/tools/superorganism) - script runner from beyond the moon 🐁",
" * [treacle](//repo.biz/tools/treacle) - command line interface tree visualization pun 🫠",
